title: Clique Guarantee H(n; p, q)
content: cliqueGuarantee n p q is the largest m such that every n-vertex graph where every p-set spans ≥ q edges contains K_m. This generalises Ramsey numbers.

title: Exponent c(p, q)
content: cpq p q = lim inf log(H(n;p,q))/log(n). This captures the polynomial rate of growth of the clique guarantee.

title: Ramsey Bounds for c(p, 1)
content: 1/(p-1) ≤ c(p,1) ≤ 2/(p+1). When q = 1, the problem reduces to classical Ramsey theory.

title: EFRS Bound
content: Erdős–Faudree–Rousseau–Schelp proved c(p, ⌊(p-1)/2⌋) ≤ 1/2, showing the exponent is at most 1/2 at the midpoint.

title: Erdős Problem 667
content: c(p,q) is strictly increasing in q for 1 ≤ q ≤ C(p-1,2)+1. Each additional edge per p-set strictly improves the clique guarantee exponent.
